column4: What is a relatively lightweight file browser with thumbnails for looking at 100 jpegs in a single directory?
I was about to suggest feh... not sure what exactly you are looking for.  Maybe "pornview"?
No, I don't look at photos of your sister.
please don't do that.  Despite it's name, it's just an image viewing app.
sorry ... still inappropriate name ... wouldn't install it and give someone the wrong idea ... few will do
you might want to check it out and see if it's the app you are looking for.  If it is, you could always recompile it with a new name

I've used Slackware (and worked on the project) for some many years ... just a few days into an Ubuntu install, and can't even figure out grub :-)  .... don't know if it would be worth the time to figure out how to recompile a gui app atm
yeah, I can relate to dead projects
I don't know of other light weight image viewers.  Maybe gthumb?
probably just stick with feh ... can't complain about it, and the thumbnail mode window fits perfectly here
